page.title: 15Link line tapes
page.content: This is a{taped magazine service produced,recorded and distributed by pupils of John Beddoes School Presteigne,since l981.The concept was based on 'talking books'for the blind,but now include the lonely,aged, isolated and infirm in the school's catchment area. 350 people listen to the monthly tapes,which now go as far afield as Leominster and Birmingham. The tapes include items of{local {interest,greetings,interviews with {regional and national media {personalities and others,}e.g.Mrs Margaret Thatcher(first female Prime Minister),Sir Robin Day (TV Presenter) Jimmy Saville O.B.E (disc jockey). In {1984,Princess Anne}was interviewed at Gatcombe Park and subsequently she officially opened the Link-Line office and studio on Sept.11th 1984. Compiled by R.Davies,J.Worgan
